00048 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00049  * @brief   This function handles NMI exception.
00050  * @retval  None
00051  ************************************************************************************************************/
00052 void NMI_Handler(void)
00053 {
00054   /* This interrupt is generated when HSE failed                                                            */
00055   if (CKCU_GetIntStatus(CKCU_INT_CKS))
00056   {
00057     /*  HSI is configured as system clock source now, both HSE & PLL clock ready
00058     flags are cleared by hardware. But PLL frequency setting are not changed. */
00059 
00060     /* After Clearing the clock stuck interrupt flag, hardware selects HSI as PLL clock source              */
00061     CKCU_ClearIntFlag(CKCU_INT_CKS);
00062 
00063     /* Enable HSE ready interrupt. Once HSE clock recover,
00064        the HSE ready interrupt is generated. */
00065     #if defined(CKCU_INT_HSERDYIE)
00066     CKCU_IntConfig(CKCU_INT_HSERDYIE, ENABLE);
00067     #endif
00068   }
00069 
00070 }
00071 
00072 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00073  * @brief   This function handles Hard Fault exception.
00074  * @retval  None
00075  ************************************************************************************************************/
00076 void HardFault_Handler(void)
00077 {
00078   #if 1
00079 
00080   static vu32 gIsContinue = 0;
00081   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00082   /* For development FW, MCU run into the while loop when the hardfault occurred.                           */
00083   /* 1. Stack Checking                                                                                      */
00084   /*    When a hard fault exception occurs, MCU push following register into the stack (main or process     */
00085   /*    stack). Confirm R13(SP) value in the Register Window and typing it to the Memory Windows, you can   */
00086   /*    check following register, especially the PC value (indicate the last instruction before hard fault).*/
00087   /*    SP + 0x00    0x04    0x08    0x0C    0x10    0x14    0x18    0x1C                                   */
00088   /*           R0      R1      R2      R3     R12      LR      PC    xPSR                                   */
00089   while (gIsContinue == 0)
00090   {
00091   }
00092   /* 2. Step Out to Find the Clue                                                                           */
00093   /*    Change the variable "gIsContinue" to any other value than zero in a Local or Watch Window, then     */
00094   /*    step out the HardFault_Handler to reach the first instruction after the instruction which caused    */
00095   /*    the hard fault.                                                                                     */
00096   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00097 
00098   #else
00099 
00100   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00101   /* For production FW, you shall consider to reboot the system when hardfault occurred.                    */
00102   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00103   NVIC_SystemReset();
00104 
00105   #endif
00106 }
00107
